name: Cabal TeamCity Build Runner Plugin
body:
### Description

[TeamCity][] is a continuous integration server. [Cabal][] is a build and
package manager for [Haskell][] programs and libraries. Even though you can quite easily invoke a build of a Cabalised Haskell program by running `cabal-install` through the command line runner, common operations such as managing and editing of build parameters or digging through long build logs can be a bit of a pain.

Cabal TeamCity Build Runner Plugin presents a tighter integration of the Cabal build process
with TeamCity with these features:
 - Effortless configuration: set up and configure a Cabal runner Build Step from a standard Build Configuration page
 - Properties: the `cabal-install` tool's location and version are exposed as Agent Parameters, allowing you to discriminate between build agents by the version of `cabal-install`
 - Hierarchical build log: it is now much easier to dig through heaps of build output,  thanks to TeamCity presenting the hierarchical structure as of the build log as a with the Tree View
 - Basic test reporting: see the number of successful and failed QuickCheck, QuickCheck 2 and HUnit test runs at a glance for when your test-suite built with Max Bolingbroke's (@batterseapower) wonderful `test-framework` (site [here][test-framework])

Finally! Quick and easy Continuous Integration for Haskell!

### Installation
To get the plugin running, simply download `cabalRunner.jar` from the [Downloads section][Project downloads]
and drop it into your `~teamcity/.BuildServer/plugins` directory, where `~teamcity` is the home directory
of the UNIX user used to run TeamCity Server, or the `<TeamCity Data Directory>/plugins` directory under Windows.

### Upgrading
When you would like to upgrade to a newer version of the plugin where a previous version of the
plugin has been installed already, simply overwrite the existing `cabalRunner.zip` file with the latest
released zip file.

TeamCity Server sees the change, and will _automatically trigger an Agent-side upgrade_ for the plugin.
TeamCity Server however will not upgrade the plugin unless you restart it, so be sure to do that
to ensure new version of the plugin becomes activated.

***

### Contact
Cabal TeamCity Build Runner Plugin began as a very small hobby project, and was implemented in the space of a few days. In the likely even you find an issue, ping me on fushunpoon@googlemail.com. We'll see what we can do from there.

### Contributing
Cabal TeamCity Build Runner Plugin is actually a derived work of [Teamcity Unity3d Build Runner plugin](https://github.com/mcmarkb/Teamcity-unity3d-build-runner-plugin) so I wish to give attribution to Mark Baker (@mcmarkb) for laying the groundwork for this plugin.

Please fork this project and help me improve it! Start by looking at some of
the [known issues](https://github.com/fushunpoon/Cabal-TeamCity-build-runner-plugin)
section of the README. Thanks!
